metadata.unit_designation: Xxi Corpo D Armata Xxi Corps
metadata.commander_name: Generale di Corpo d'Armata Enea Navarini

narrative.title: Xxi Corpo D Armata Xxi Corps - 1943Q1
narrative.situation: Italian corps deployed in North Africa during 1943Q1.
narrative.objectives: XXI Corps role in 1943-Q1 Tunisia unclear. Corps had been infantry corps for static defense and positional warfare during 1940-1942 Libya/Egypt campaigns. Destroyed at Second Battle of El Alamein (October-November 1942) with subordinate divisions Trento (destroyed 25 November 1942) and Bologna (largely destroyed, survivors retreated on foot). No Italian divisions in 1943-Q1 Tunisia list XXI Corps as parent formation, suggesting corps was non-operational, disbanded, or held skeletal command status awaiting reconstitution that never occurred.
narrative.axis_objective: Maintain defensive positions and inflict maximum casualties on Allied forces.
narrative.allied_objective: Advance and secure strategic objectives while minimizing casualties.

weather.terrain: Tunisia - location unknown if corps was operational. Likely rear area if skeletal headquarters existed.
